str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Rebuke, reproof, refutation. From elegcho; refutation, i.e. Reproof.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A transgression, violation of law. From the same as paranomeo; transgression: iniquity.
A beast of burden, an ass or mule. Neuter of a compound of hupo and zugos; an animal under the yoke, i.e., a donkey.
Soundless, voiceless, speechless, dumb. Figuratively, unmeaning.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To speak aloud, utter. Probably akin to pheggos and thus to phemi; to utter a clear sound, i.e. to proclaim.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To prevent, debar, hinder; with infin: from doing so and so. From the base of kolazo; to estop, i.e. Prevent.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
Madness, folly. From paraphroneo; insanity, i.e. Foolhardiness.
